member.name: T:CrawlWave.Common.UI.HealthLineGraph
member.summary: HealthLineGraph is a subclass of that can display a usage history graph like the one in Windows Task Manager. It offers user- selectable forecolor, grid color and background color and it can hold up to 800 values. Since each time it is redrawn it is shifted by 2 pixels this means that it can hold enough values to fill a 1600x1200 pixel resolution screen.

member.summary: Sets the new value to be displayed in the control, makes sure that the grid is moved one step forward and calculates the current maximum value, so that the height of the line can be adjusted dynamically.
member.param: The new value to be displayed in the control.

member.name: P:CrawlWave.Common.UI.HealthLineGraph.Value
member.summary: Gets the value currently displayed by the control

member.name: P:CrawlWave.Common.UI.HealthLineGraph.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value supported by the control
member.exception: Thrown if the value provided is negative.

member.name: P:CrawlWave.Common.UI.HealthLineGraph.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the control's maximum supported value
member.exception: Thrown if the value provided is negative or smaller than the value of the property.

member.name: P:CrawlWave.Common.UI.HealthLineGraph.NextValue
member.summary: Sets the next value to be displayed and causes the control to redraw
member.remarks: If the value supplied is greater than the value of the property then the value of the Maximum property is set to the current value. This causes the graph to redraw and dynamically adapt to the new range.
member.exception: Thrown if the value provided is smaller than the value of the property.
